alert.note: Alert for Bergen (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 8:48AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by yesterday`s excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A small portion of Bergen County in northeast New Jersey. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 848 AM EDT, Gauge reports indicated rapid rises along the Hackensack River have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. - This includes the following streams and drainages... The Hackensack River between Lake Tappan and the Oradell Reservoir. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding along and near the Hackensack River include... River Vale, Old Tappan, and Harrington Park. Downstream flooding south of the Oradell Reservoir is not expected. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and avoid flooded areas.
